intro: Cynanchum stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes many species of milkweeds known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually greenish-white in color, with a distinctive corona structure. Cynanchum stenophyllum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,500 meters.
